Why is this?
Because the bodhisattva cultivates the karma for the marks and their results, all for the sake of receiving the supreme fruits in his final body, but does not immediately enjoy them.
However, due to those karmas as the dominant conditions, he creates other good karmas that lead to the results of the marks of a wheel-turning king.
It is like a very wealthy elder who has many precious treasures.
Among them, the most valuable jewel is not immediately used.
